title: How to Make a Noodle Beverage Boat

steps.headline: Find or purchase a large plastic container.
steps.description: The best kind of container is one created from sturdy, clear plastic with an even, not too heavy weight.

steps.headline: Clean out the plastic container before using.
steps.description: Even if you just purchased the container, make sure it’s totally clean before you add your ice and drinks. Use hot, soapy water, rinse well and then dry with a clean towel.

steps.headline: Hold a trial run by placing cans or bottles in the container so you can estimate how much it could possibly hold.
steps.description: Keep in mind that you will most likely be filling this container with ice too.

steps.headline: Cut a pool noodle into four equal parts.
steps.description: This is the floating device to keep your beverage boat afloat on the “high seas”, so use a good quality new or undamaged pool noodle.

steps.headline: Measure each side of your container and cut the noodle to fit each side.
steps.description:
Use either strong scissors or a very sharp knife to cut the noodle. If your container is round, you may not even need to cut the noodle, but instead simply wrap it around the container. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d9\/Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-2Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d9\/Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-2Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":326,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":538.6813186813187,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Thread the noodle parts over a long, sturdy string or rope.
Fit the noodle pieces around the plastic container.
steps.description:
Slide the noodle square or rectangle around your container and pull the string tight. Create a snug fit by tying a small knot at the base of the string so that the noodle string does not expand and release the container of drinks. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a0\/Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a0\/Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Test the container in the pool without the drinks to make sure it not only floats but to be sure that the noodle fit is correct.
steps.description: You could fill the container with other pool toys to determine how it holds weight.

text:
Preparing a suitable container Find or purchase a large plastic container. The best kind of container is one created from sturdy, clear plastic with an even, not too heavy weight. Clean out the plastic container before using. Even if you just purchased the container, make sure it’s totally clean before you add your ice and drinks. Use hot, soapy water, rinse well and then dry with a clean towel. Hold a trial run by placing cans or bottles in the container so you can estimate how much it could possibly hold. Keep in mind that you will most likely be filling this container with ice too. Fitting the noodle float Cut a pool noodle into four equal parts. This is the floating device to keep your beverage boat afloat on the “high seas”, so use a good quality new or undamaged pool noodle. Measure each side of your container and cut the noodle to fit each side. Use either strong scissors or a very sharp knife to cut the noodle. If your container is round, you may not even need to cut the noodle, but instead simply wrap it around the container. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":326,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":538.6813186813187,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Thread the noodle parts over a long, sturdy string or rope. The rope will allow you to adhere the noodle parts to your boat. Thread the noodle parts together to create a square (or rectangular) shape that will fit snugly around your container. Use a strong, secure rope or string with enough slack that extends beyond the boat. You will use the remainder of the string as your “pull” so your drinks are never far away. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/56/Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/56/Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make a loop at the end of the string that fits easily around your finger or wrist, giving you easy access to your boat. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/69/Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/69/Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Fit the noodle pieces around the plastic container. Slide the noodle square or rectangle around your container and pull the string tight. Create a snug fit by tying a small knot at the base of the string so that the noodle string does not expand and release the container of drinks. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Noodle-Beverage-Boat-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Test the container in the pool without the drinks to make sure it not only floats but to be sure that the noodle fit is correct. You could fill the container with other pool toys to determine how it holds weight.
